meanings.definition: Relating to or consisting of three lines or segments.
meanings.sent1: The trisemic pattern on the wall was made of three colorful lines.
meanings.sent2: The trisemic design on the floor added a unique touch to the room.
meanings.sent3: The trisemic painting looked like a rainbow divided into three parts.
meanings.sent4: Her trisemic hairstyle featured three braided sections.
meanings.sent5: The trisemic flag fluttered in the wind, displaying three distinct stripes.

meanings.definition: A group of three lines or segments.
meanings.sent1: She drew a trisemic on the paper using three different colored markers.
meanings.sent2: The trisemic in the artwork symbolized unity, strength, and harmony.
meanings.sent3: The trisemic of friends always stuck together like three peas in a pod.
meanings.sent4: The trisemic of trees in the park created a beautiful natural boundary.
meanings.sent5: The trisemic of books on the shelf caught her attention with its symmetry.

meanings.definition: To divide into three parts or sections.
meanings.sent1: She decided to trisemic the cake into equal portions for the guests.
meanings.sent2: The chef will trisemic the ingredients to create a balanced flavor profile.
meanings.sent3: He tried to trisemic his time between work, family, and hobbies.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to trisemic the landscape, splitting it into three distinct areas.
meanings.sent5: The artist planned to trisemic the canvas to showcase a triptych of images.
